transportAdvice: Colombo has an extensive public bus network and a commuter rail line that connects key parts of the city, though both can be crowded during peak hours. Taxis and three-wheeled tuk-tuks are widely available and practical for tourists, while walking is feasible in specific neighborhoods but challenging across the city due to traffic and heat.

weather.description: Warm and mostly sunny with low rainfall, making it one of the more pleasant months to visit Colombo.
Dry and hot with clear skies, ideal conditions for sightseeing around the city.
Temperatures begin to climb and it remains largely dry, though afternoons can feel very hot.
The first inter-monsoon period brings increasing humidity and occasional heavy showers.
The southwest monsoon arrives, bringing frequent and heavy rainfall throughout the month.
Monsoon conditions continue with persistent rain and overcast skies, though downpours are often intense but brief.
Wet and humid with regular rainfall; outdoor activities may be disrupted by showers.
Monsoon rains persist, keeping temperatures slightly cooler but humidity remains high.
Rainfall begins to ease slightly toward the end of the month as the monsoon starts to withdraw.
The second inter-monsoon period brings renewed heavy showers and thunderstorms.
The northeast monsoon brings significant rainfall to Colombo, with frequent wet and overcast days.
Rainfall gradually decreases through the month, with conditions improving toward the end of December.
